page.title: 10CHURCH
page.content: With the exception of the tower the church in Wootton St. Lawrence was rebuilt in 1868 when the south aisle was added.The south doorway was rebuilt and partly restored.When they were rebuilding the church they found a wooden trowel in one of the pillars. They are linked with Oakley parish.The family service is held there.They have holy communion once a month.The organ used to be a pump organ but now it's an electric organ.Mr.Butler was an 17th century vicar who wrote the first book on bees.The church has a copy of it and there is a stained glass window of him holding the bee book.Both the book and the window are quite well known. There have been 43 vicars since 1300.
